articles.title: An abandoned tent has spurred a hiking mystery in New Hampshire
articles.description:
Whoever set up the tent was nowhere to be found, but Fish and Game officials had no reports of missing hikers.

The post An abandoned tent has spurred a hiking mystery in New Hampshire appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Fish and Game officials found an abandoned tent in New Hampshire without any missing hiker reports.
No hikers reported missing as of November 6, 2025, raising safety concerns for local outdoor enthusiasts.
Boston residents are advised to stay vigilant while hiking in New Hampshire's trails amid this mystery.

articles.title: A former teacher shot by a 6-year-old student wins $10M jury verdict against ex-assistant principal
articles.description:
Abby Zwerner was shot in January 2023 as she sat at a reading table in her first-grade classroom.

The post A former teacher shot by a 6-year-old student wins $10M jury verdict against ex-assistant principal appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Abby Zwerner was shot by a 6-year-old student in January 2023.
Zwerner won a $10 million jury verdict against the ex-assistant principal.
This case raises concerns about school safety and accountability in Boston.

articles.title: Elon Musk could become history’s first trillionaire as Tesla shareholders approve giant pay package
articles.description:
“Fantastic group of shareholders," Musk said after the final vote was tallied.

The post Elon Musk could become history’s first trillionaire as Tesla shareholders approve giant pay package appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Tesla shareholders approved a massive pay package for Elon Musk.
Musk's potential wealth could reach $1 trillion, impacting local economies.
Boston investors may see changes in stock market dynamics due to Musk's financial influence.

articles.title: Man who threw sandwich at federal agent in Washington, D.C., is found not guilty of assault charge
articles.description:
A viral video of the sandwich tossing made Sean Charles Dunn a symbol of resistance to Trump’s deployment of federal agents to combat crime in the nation’s capital.

The post Man who threw sandwich at federal agent in Washington, D.C., is found not guilty of assault charge appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Sean Charles Dunn was found not guilty of assault for throwing a sandwich.
The incident occurred during protests against federal agent deployments in D.C.
Dunn's case highlights local concerns about federal law enforcement in Boston.

articles.title: Federal judge orders Trump administration to fully fund SNAP benefits in November
articles.description:
A federal judge in Rhode Island has ordered the Trump administration to find the money to fully fund SNAP benefits for November

The post Federal judge orders Trump administration to fully fund SNAP benefits in November appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Federal judge orders full funding for SNAP benefits in November 2023.
The ruling affects thousands of Boston residents relying on SNAP assistance.
Increased funding aims to alleviate food insecurity in the local community.

articles.title: Local obituary: Susan Hurley, 62, former Patriots cheerleader who founded CharityTeams
articles.description:
"The cornerstone of her endeavors was her work with the Boston Marathon."

The post Local obituary: Susan Hurley, 62, former Patriots cheerleader who founded CharityTeams appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Susan Hurley, 62, passed away, impacting Boston's community and charity landscape.
She founded CharityTeams, supporting runners in the Boston Marathon.
Hurley's legacy includes fostering community engagement and charitable efforts in Boston.
